32B.F.summary: Bialetti Industrie S.p.A. manufacturers and sells coffee pots and makers, and espresso machines in Italy. The company offers coffee capsules, and grounds and grains; monovalent and trivalent espresso machines; and moka, filtered, and special coffee makers, as well as coffee maker accessories. It also provides cookware, including plates and pans, accessories for special cooking, pots and casseroles, and molds; coffee cups and accessories; and small appliances. The company offers its products under the Bialetti, Aeternum, Rondine, and CEM brands. The company was founded in 1919 and is headquartered in Coccaglio, Italy. Bialetti Industrie S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Bialetti Holding srl.

7L4.F.summary: Elica S.p.A. designs, manufactures, and sells motors for cooker hoods and central heating boilers in Europe and CIS countries, America, and internationally. The company offers wall mounted, built-in, island, corner, ceiling, and downdraft hoods. It designs, manufactures, and sells electric motors, hoods for domestic use, and boilers. In addition, the company produces and sells various range of hoods, gas hobs, kitchenware sterilizers, and kitchen home appliances. It offers its products under the Elica, Turboair, Jetair, Ariafina, Arietta, Puti, and FIME brand names. The company was founded in 1970 and is headquartered in Fabriano, Italy. Elica S.p.A. is a subsidiary of Fan S.A.

9WT.F.summary: Illa S.p.A. produces and sells cookware products in Italy. The company provides ceramic pans; pots, pans, skillets, saucepans, and casseroles with non-stick coatings; stone coated pots and pans; and vegetal oil coating products. It also exports its products to Northern Europe and the United States. The company was founded in 1946 and is headquartered in Noceto, Italy.

DLG.MI.summary: De'Longhi S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, manufactures and distributes coffee making products, food preparation and cooking machines, air conditioners and portable heaters, domestic cleaning devices, and ironing systems. The company provides its products primarily under the De'Longhi, Kenwood, Braun, Nespresso, Nutribullet, Magic Bullet, and Ariete brands. It has operation in Europe, the Middle East, India, Africa, the Asia/Pacific, and the Americas. The company was founded in 1900 and is headquartered in Treviso, Italy. De'Longhi S.p.A. is a subsidiary of De Longhi Industrial S.A.

DLN.F.summary: De'Longhi S.p.A., together with its subsidiaries, manufactures and distributes coffee making products, food preparation and cooking machines, air conditioners and portable heaters, domestic cleaning devices, and ironing systems. The company provides its products primarily under the De'Longhi, Kenwood, Braun, Nespresso, Nutribullet, Magic Bullet, and Ariete brands. It has operation in Europe, the Middle East, India, Africa, the Asia/Pacific, and the Americas. The company was founded in 1900 and is headquartered in Treviso, Italy. De'Longhi S.p.A. is a subsidiary of De Longhi Industrial S.A.

The company provides ceramic pans; pots, pans, skillets, saucepans, and casseroles with non-stick coatings; stone coated pots and pans; and vegetal oil coating products. It also exports its products to Northern Europe and the United States. The company was founded in 1946 and is headquartered in Noceto, Italy.

NTZ.summary: Natuzzi S.p.A. designs, manufactures, and markets leather and fabric upholstered furniture through its own and franchised stores worldwide. The company operates through two segments, Natuzzi Brand and Private Label. Its products primarily include stationary furniture, such as sofas, loveseats, and armchairs; sectional furniture; motion furniture; sofa beds; occasional chairs, including recliners and massage chairs; and home furnishing accessories, including coffee tables, lamps, rugs, home accessories, and wall units. The company also sells polyurethane foam and leather by-products. As of December 31, 2020, it operated 237 Natuzzi Italia stores; 72 Divani&Divani by Natuzzi stores; and 250 Natuzzi Editions stores. The company was formerly known as Industrie Natuzzi S.p.A. and changed its name to Natuzzi S.p.A. in June 2002. Natuzzi S.p.A. was incorporated in 1959 and is headquartered in Santeramo in Colle, Italy.

RAD.MI.summary: Radici Pietro Industries & Brands S.p.A. manufactures woven carpets worldwide. It provides carpets for various applications, including residential, hotels, offices, marine, aircraft, automotive, and sport and landscape. The company was founded in 1950 and is based in Cazzano Sant'Andrea, Italy.
